subject.name: Constitution of India / Essence of Indian Knowledge Traditional
subject.description: Introduces the framework, philosophy, and principles of the Indian Constitution along with the social, political, and cultural heritage shaping it. Explores the structure of government, fundamental rights, duties, and directive principles, and connects constitutional ideas with India’s traditional knowledge and liberal thought.
objectives: To understand the meaning, evolution, and philosophy of the Indian Constitution
To study the structure, powers, and functions of different organs of government
To learn about the Fundamental Rights, Duties, and Directive Principles of State Policy
To understand the historical and cultural context of Indian constitutionalism
To appreciate the role of the judiciary and constitutional amendments in protecting rights and ensuring justice

units.title: Introduction to the Constitution of India
topics: Meaning of the Constitution and constitutionalism
Historical perspective of the Constitution of India
Salient features and characteristics of the Constitution

units.title: Fundamental Rights, Duties, and Directive Principles
topics: Scheme of the Fundamental Duties and their legal status
Directive Principles of State Policy – Importance and implementation

units.title: Structure and Functioning of Government
topics: Federal structure and distribution of legislative and financial powers between the Union and the States
Parliamentary form of Government in India – Powers and status of the President of India
Amendment of the Constitutional Powers and Procedure

units.title: Judiciary and Constitutional Amendments
topics: Historical perspectives of constitutional amendments in India
Judicial activism and the role of the Supreme Court
Landmark judgments strengthening the basic structure doctrine

units.title: Emergency and Local Governance Provisions
topics: Emergency Provisions: National Emergency, President’s Rule, and Financial Emergency
Local Self-Government – Constitutional scheme in India

units.title: Fundamental Rights and Equality
topics: Scheme of the Fundamental Right to Equality
Scheme of the Fundamental Right to Certain Freedoms under Article 19
Scope of the Right to Life and Personal Liberty under Article 21
